utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How much will it hurt?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s just a tiny skin sample. You saw me do it to myself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: On a scale of one to ten, where one is a pebble in your shoe and ten is the monkey you thought was your pet biting your face off.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: A two.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Eating a whole Altoid?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, if I’m gonna synthesize a neural network from our skin cells, I need to harvest them. Now, I’ve done this dozens of times, but if you’re too scared you don’t have to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, this is for science. I can be brave for science.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, jiminy, that’s cold.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just think how happy you’ll be in a few weeks when I’ve converted our skin cells into functional brain cells.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, just warn me before you do it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. Three, two, and we’re done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You tricked me. You didn’t say one.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It didn’t hurt, did it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, but three, two and we’re done is incomplete. You know those things bother me. It’s like hearing da-da-da-da-da-dah without yelling…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, fine, one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Now yell charge and we can get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God, I just got it. Fun onions, Funyuns. Hold on. Is that a wobble? Yes. That’s definitely a gravitational wobble.

utterance.speaker: Cleaner
utterance.content: Uh, sorry, I could come back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, no, it’s okay. I just found a wobble.

utterance.speaker: Cleaner
utterance.content: Oh, do I need a mop?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s a gravitational wobble. It could be a sign of an extrasolar planet that may contain life and someday be named after me.

utterance.speaker: Cleaner
utterance.content: Oh, well, if it has life, maybe it already has a name, huh?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s probably difficult to pronounce.

utterance.speaker: Cleaner
utterance.content: What is your name?

utterance.speaker: Cleaner
utterance.content: You think it would be more difficult than that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good point. And you are?

utterance.speaker: Cleaner
utterance.content: Oh, uh, Isabella Maria Concepcion.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, well, nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Nice to meet you, too. You know, I have to say, based on the candy wrappers and the bags of junk food I see in this trash, working here was ten years old.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, please, show me a ten-year-old who knows to dip Tootsie Rolls in Nutella.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Bueno, um, I’m just going to empty your waste paper basket and then I’ll get out of your way.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, please, allow me. That’s a lot of empty calories.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Okay, uh, okay, I have to go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Good luck with your, um, space exploration.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you. Good luck with your future endeavours.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did it work? Are they brain cells yet?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If you’d give me a minute, I’ll tell you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, just let me look. Oh, my goodness. I see quivering black lines. Those must be neurons, oh, they’re so thick and beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Those are your eyelashes, move. Well, Sheldon, I see astrocytes. Our combined skin cells are now a primitive neural network.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have such a profound sense of creation. I, it’s like when I hatched sea monkeys, except that this is from my DNA, so this is like me monkeys.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: These cells come from both of us.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but us monkeys doesn’t pop. Oh, oh, oh, oh, wait, we monkeys, there you go. Hey, when can we start running tests on it?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No reason we can’t start right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What stimulus should we introduce it to first? Light, sound, temperature, oh, oh, let’s

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, this is a rudimentary collection of neurons. I mean, it’s remarkable, but it’s still limited in what it can do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I understand. She’s the mean one, I’m the fun one.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Huh, they screwed up and gave us steamed broccoli.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, no, that’s mine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? The last green thing I saw you eat was a Skittle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I can’t eat like a ten-year-old all the time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re dating somebody, who is it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You only watch what you eat when you’re afraid you might have to take your shirt off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, she’s right. As long as I’ve known you, you’ve always been self-conscious about your cleavage.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s because you keep trying to stick pencils in it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, fine, don’t tell us.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There’s nothing to tell.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How’s that broccoli?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s gross but I have to eat it because I met somebody.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bam. Thank you. What’s her name?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Isabella.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, did you meet her at work?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, in the telescope room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, so she’s an astronomer?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, which is why she was in the telescope room. Yes, this is all making sense. Good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, that’s great, Raj. You must have so much in common.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, when do we meet her?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no, this is brand new. We haven’t even been on a proper date yet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, good luck with it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How come you never eat broccoli?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m married, I don’t have to be attractive.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, most people don’t realize this technique has actually been around for a few years.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Still, I can’t believe you can turn ordinary skin cells into functioning brain cells.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I turned this one into a functioning boyfriend, so sky’s the limit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look, look, here I am standing next to the incubator. Uh, here is a microscopic view of the cells.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Look at that, put them in a tiny Flash T-shirt and it’s you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aw. Yeah, this little guy can already recognize electronically transmitted images 20% faster than any other sample in Amy’s lab.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m running out of ways to act excited.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, enough about us, how are things going with you?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Great, the doctor said the baby’s head is facing down now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good, you know, in case the exit isn’t clearly marked.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I have to say, it is nice to share this experience with someone who’s on the same journey. Although right now ours is testing off the charts while yours is floating around in its own waste.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you actually comparing my human baby to your brain in a bowl?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I didn’t make you waddle up four flights of stairs for the heck of it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You do realize my baby has functioning organs and can recognize voices.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but ours can recognize a specific data stream among background noise.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Mine has a fully developed immune system.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ours doesn’t need an immune system because it lives in a state-of-the-art German incubator.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, that’s enough.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Let’s just agree that both creations are special in their own way and it is foolish to try and compare them. Although, we didn’t need to have sex with Howard for ours, so we win.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is fun. I have never cleaned a toilet before.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I grew up with a house full of servants and now I have a cleaning lady who is a lovely woman who I have great respect for.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: It’s okay, you’re allowed to have a cleaning lady.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, good, because she also walks my dog, buys my groceries and cuts my hair.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: I think that’s called a mommy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, so forgive me, forgive me for being nosy, but is, is there a wedding ring under those pretty rubber gloves?

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: No, not for many years.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, so, you are unencumbered?

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Just me and my son.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I love kids, how old is he?

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Nineteen.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s a cute age. They can do so many things.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: He’s studying to be a lawyer at UCLA.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s wonderful. A lawyer, my sister’s a lawyer. Look at that, we have something in common.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess we do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe there are other things we have in common. Come dinnertime, do you enjoy eating food?

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Ay, Rajesh, I think you’re very sweet, but I work two jobs and I don’t have time for dating.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. I understand. Yeah, I’m very busy, too.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Oh, please don’t take it personal, I think you’re a very nice man.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think you’re very nice as well.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Thank you for helping me. Good night, Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yes. Oh, okay. Uh, Good night. I don’t know, maybe it’s the fumes from the urinal cakes, but I feel like something is happening between us.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Good night, Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll leave. But just know, every time I come in here, I’ll be thinking of you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you look at that? The image we gave it was 45% white noise, and it still managed to reconstruct it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ve never seen results like this before.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, we need to stop for magnets on the way home, this is going right on the fridge.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Aren’t you glad you participated in this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I am. And you realize what the next step is?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Set up a second culture and try to replicate our results.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, no. We lock that door, lower our underpants a little and make a baby.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Make a baby? What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Clearly the combination of our DNA is exceptional. Our child could be the next step in the evolution of mankind. We’ll be able to get into any preschool we want!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m not ready to have a baby.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes, you are. I track your cycle. For the next 36 hours you’re as fertile as a manure-covered wheat field.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wow. I, I can actually feel the egg crawling its way back up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand. I thought you’d be thrilled to procreate with me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I see what’s happening here. You’re playing hard to get.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m not playing anything. We’re not making a baby today.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well. Oops, how clumsy of me. You know what? Let me get that. Hey. Where are you going? I, did you even look at my bottom?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Welcome.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, well, you said you didn’t have time to go out for dinner, so I thought we could have one right here.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Oh, Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, come on, we’re in the telescope room. It’ll be like dining under the stars. You see this, uh, double zero? When it says zero one that means it’s twinkling. Sometimes it takes a while.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Rajesh, this is so sweet, but you, you know I’m working.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s why I already cleaned up in here and all the other rooms in the hall.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Well, I suppose that gives me a little time.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, please sit. I tried to cook you a meal from your homeland.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Oh, really? You made Cuban food?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That depends, do they have Mexican food in Cuba?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Now, when he said make a baby, is it possible he meant out of Legos?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. He was explicit. Needlessly and freakishly explicit.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why does he need a baby? He’s already hairless and smells like talcum powder.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Could you two really have some sort of super-intelligent child?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, there is a genetic component, but that doesn’t guarantee anything.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s true. Sheldon’s father once picked a fight with a cactus.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, but that’s just his Earth parents. We don’t know anything about the ones that sent him here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we know they were smart enough to send him away.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hey, you’re talking about the person I love and have been avoiding for the past three hours. Oh, man.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, Sheldon gonna get some.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, have fun with whatever nightmare’s behind door number two.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you care for a brandy?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good choice, it’s disgusting.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, please stop trying to seduce me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who’s trying to seduce you? After a long day I always turn on smooth jazz and spray deer musk on my inner thighs.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I thought it smelled like a petting zoo in here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Anything you’d like to pet? Not my hair. There’s a lot of goop in it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, I’ve had enough.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, come back. I don’t know how to open the oysters.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, um, what surprised you the most when you first came to America?

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Well, I suppose how much people care about Oprah’s favourite things.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I thought that, too. But then I got my first waffle maker and never questioned her again.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: You know, I do have some time off this Sunday if you’d like to…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey! I saw your car… Oh, sorry. Am I interrupting?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: It’s okay. Uh, I should get back to work.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi. Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Oh. Isabella Concepcion.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, the astronomer. Raj told us about you. Hey, free toilet paper.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: You told him I was an astronomer?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: I understand. Time to go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, p-please don’t.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: It’s okay, Rajesh, I’m a grown woman. I don’t have to waste my time with someone who’s embarrassed by me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I can keep this, right?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Isabella. Isabella wait, wait, let me explain.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: If you are embarrassed by what I do, why did you pursue me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Honestly, I didn’t think your job would bother me, but I guess it did. And I hate myself for that. But there’s a lot of things about me that would totally embarrass you.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: I doubt that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, prepare to be mortified. I let my dog eat food out of my mouth, not because she likes it but because I do. Also, I know they’re pretty, but I’m scared of butterflies.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry, just passing through. I think this fell off your cart.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on. What do you say? Let me make it up to you.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: You’re very persistent.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s my one move.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Okay. This Sunday night, you may take me to dinner at a nice restaurant.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great. Where would you like to go?

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: Your choice. It can be Pakistani food if you like.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me, but I’m Indian.

utterance.speaker: Isabella
utterance.content: And now you know how it feels.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, were you turned on even a little bit?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It was like being hit on by Rat Pack Pee-wee Herman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, is that a yes?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, I didn’t want it to come to this, but you have left me no choice but to employ the most passionate, seductive dance known to man. The flamenco.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: For God’s sake, you’re ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You guys are aroused, right?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That was a close one.
